Cadmium¶

Python library for Solid Modelling

class cadmium.Solid(s=None)¶

Base class for all solids (Primitive and Custom). It’s created by passing in Shape as argument.

__add__(other)¶

Union with other solid.

__mul__(other)¶

Intersect with other solid

__sub__(other)¶

Subtract other solid from this

center()¶

Returns center of the solid

This algo takes into consideration the initial center adjustment (if one was done). This adjustment is done in the constructor of primitive, based on its dimensions

translate(x=0, y=0, z=0, delta=[, 0, 0, 0])¶

Translate the solid. Either provide delta or one of x,y,z. If either x,y or z are non-zero, delta will be ignored.

Parameters:
  • delta (float) – Translation vector
  • x (float) – Translation along X
  • y (float) – Translation along Y
  • z (float) – Translation along Z
rotate(axis=<OCC.gp.gp_Ax1; proxy of <Swig Object of type 'gp_Ax1 *' at 0xa93f368> >, angle=0)¶

Rotate the solid

Parameters:
  • axis – One of three principal axes (cadmium.X_axis, cadmium.Y_axis, cadmium.Z_Axis)
  • angle (float) – in Degrees
scale(scale=1, scaleX=1, scaleY=1, scaleZ=1, reference=None)¶

Scale the solid. Either provide scale parameter for uniform scaling along all axis. If scale is not provided, but one of scaleX,scaleY,scaleZ is provided, the solid is scaled along respective dimensions.

Parameters:
  • scale (float) – Uniform scale factor along all dimensions
  • scaleX (float) – Scale factor along X
  • scaleY (float) – Scale factor along Y
  • scaleZ (float) – Scale factor along Z
shear(xy=0, xz=0, yx=0, yz=0, zx=0, zy=0)¶

Shear the solid

Parameters:
  • xy (float) – Shear along X-axis as function of y
  • xz (float) – Shear along X-axis as function of z
  • yx (float) – Shear along Y-axis as function of x
  • yz (float) – Shear along Y-axis as function of z
  • zx (float) – Shear along Z-axis as function of x
  • zy (float) – Shear along Z-axis as function of y
toSTL(filename, ascii=False, deflection=0.01)¶

Writes STL output of the solid

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – Path of the file to write JSON to
  • ascii (bool) – choose between ASCII or Binary STL format
  • deflection (float) – Provides control over quality of exported STL. Higher the deflection value, lower the accuracy of exported STL, smaller the size of resulting file. Lower the deflection value, more accurate the exported STL, bigger the size of resulting file.
toJSON(filename, compress=False, precision=0.01)¶

Writes JSON representation of the mesh

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – Path of the file to write JSON to
  • precision (float) – Provides control over quality of exported mesh. Higher the precision value, lower the accuracy of exported mesh, smaller the size of exported file. Lower the precision value, more accurate the exported mesh, bigger the size of exported file.
exception cadmium.CadmiumException(msg)¶

Useful mainly for validating user provided input for Solid instantiations

Primitive Solids¶

class cadmium.Cylinder(r=None, radius=None, r1=None, r2=None, height=None, h=None, pie=360, center=False)¶
class cadmium.Sphere(r=None, radius=None, phi=360, center=False)¶
class cadmium.Box(x=10, y=10, z=10, center=False)¶
class cadmium.Cone(r=None, radius=None, h=None, height=None, pie=360, center=False)¶
class cadmium.Wedge(dx=5, dy=5, dz=5, center=True, ltx=0)¶
class cadmium.Torus(r1=None, r2=None, angle=360, center=False)¶
